keyword: how many calories in a ham and cheese sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Ham and Cheese Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a ham and cheese sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations under 160 characters.
h1: How Many Calories in a Ham and Cheese Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 oz deli ham, 1 oz cheddar cheese, no condiments or mayo; toasted lightly.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, meat/cheese brands, portion sizes, and added ingredients like mayo or veggies. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard ham and cheese sandwich provides about 350 kcal and 18 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a ham and cheese sandwich without mayo?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a basic version with bread, ham, and cheese.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a ham and cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Typically 18 g from the ham and cheese.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in a ham and cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”whole wheat may add fiber but similar calories; white bread is around 38 g carbs.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a ham and cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 950 mg, mostly from processed ham and cheese.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie ham and cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Opt for low-fat cheese, thin-sliced ham, or whole grain bread to reduce by 50-100 kcal.
